sec.title: AADE’s DEAP Offers Accreditation for Your DSME/T Program
sec.p: Raise your DSME/T program to the next level by obtaining accreditation with AADE. The Diabetes Education Accreditation Program (DEAP) of AADE is a Nationally Accredited Organization (NAO) by Medicare and provides accreditation for diabetes education programs, making programs eligible for Medicare reimbursement.

DEAP is available to all DSMT programs whether they just started or have been providing services for years. DEAP accredits programs on the National Standards for Diabetes Education ensuring a level of quality that gives you and your patients the confidence they need to be successful in self-managing their diabetes.

The application process is an affordable, streamlined no-fuss process, and DEAP staff is there for you to provide excellent customer support and technical assistance throughout. AADE’s simple fee structure beginning at $800 for a program with 1-10 sites, allows you to grow your program over time and our easy to navigate website makes applying as easy as possible.
Visit us online at www.diabeteseducator.org/accreditation for more information. Send questions to deap@aadenet.org or call 1-800-338-3633 M-F during regular business hours.

sec.title: Attend an AADE Regional Program
sec.p: Using member feedback, the AADE on Location events have been reorganized and expanded to these new and improved events. Now you can join other AADE members in your area at a special continuing education and networking event. During the program, you will learn about AADE’s newest initiatives and meet your volunteer leaders and key AADE staff.

These Regional Programs are designed to provide you with the latest information in diabetes care as well as the opportunity to connect and collaborate with fellow AADE members in your area. With an agenda focused on educational, networking, and social experiences, we hope you will come away from the event both recharged and inspired!
You will have the opportunity to learn firsthand how AADE is working on a local level to help you better care for your patients. These member events will also allow you to:

list-item.p: network with diabetes health care professionals in your area

sec.title: AADE Joins Capella University’s Corporate Alliance Program
sec.p: We are pleased to announce that AADE has joined Capella University’s Corporate Alliance Program. This alliance offers AADE members these benefits:

The MSN in Diabetes Nursing specialization focuses on theories and evidence-based therapeutics to care for the special needs of individuals and vulnerable populations with diabetes and related conditions. The program provides students with real-world experiences and gives them the opportunity to collaborate with leaders across the public administration, public safety, and health care fields.

People likely to be interested in this specialization include nurses pursuing advanced roles as diabetes specialists and practitioner-scholars in a variety of research, clinical, and educational settings.

AADE members are eligible to receive a $3000 grant for enrolling in a degree program at Capella. This grant is available to students starting a course between April 2012 and September 2012, and will be applied to the first 6 quarters ($500 per quarter).
For more information, visit www.capella.edu/aade or call 1-888-227-9896.

sec.title: BC-ADM Exam Now Available
sec.p: Achieve greatness in your career by obtaining Board Certification in Advanced Diabetes Management (BC-ADM) with AADE.
Attain a high level of expertise in your specialty and see your services and patients thrive.

The scope of advanced diabetes practice enhances patient management skills such as medication adjustment, medical nutrition therapy, exercise planning, counseling for behavior management and psychosocial issues. The BC-ADM includes an increased complexity of decision making expanding the traditional diabetes education practice including research, mentoring, and continuing professional development.
For the first time ever AADE has opened up the BC-ADM to physicians and physician assistants in addition to the RN, RD, and pharmacist. Don’t get left behind!
For more information on eligibility, schedule and requirements please visit: http://www.diabeteseducator.org/bcadm.
Or send questions to: BCADM@AADENET.ORG.

sec.title: Learn Advanced Management for Hospital Patients With Diabetes
sec.p: One of three new advanced courses, the Advanced Inpatient Diabetes Management, is an advanced self-paced, 4-module online course that focuses on the art and science of caring for patients with hyperglycemia and/or diabetes in the hospital setting. Those who complete the course will earn 4 CE credits.
Learning modules include:

list-item.p: Module 2: Non-Critical Care Setting: Insulin Therapy
Module 3: Meeting Glycemic Targets in Non-Critical Care Setting: Barriers & Possible Solutions
Module 4: Special Considerations in Acute Care.

sec.p: This and other online courses on Gestational Diabetes (4 CE) and CGM (12 CE) are available any time. Register and learn more at www.diabeteseducator.org/advanced4.

sec.title: Core Concepts Available This Fall
sec.p: The live, 3-day course has been updated with expanded topics for 2012. In addition to over 20 CE, the live courses feature the chance to network with health care professionals from around the nation. They will be held 2 more times in 2012:

The interactive nature of the Core Concepts® course is one of its most valuable aspects. It is facilitated by a multidisciplinary team of registered health care professionals, including a nurse, dietitian, and pharmacist. Case studies are used throughout the course, allowing for discussion and sharing of knowledge among participants.
You can save $30 on a one-year AADE membership when you join or renew and register for the Core Concepts Course. For more information about the live course, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/ccc8.

sec.title: Introduce Your Team to the ABCs of Diabetes Education
sec.p: If you work on a team with non-diabetes educator clinicians who want to enhance their ability to work with patients with diabetes, AADE has developed an online course that can help them reach their goal. Nurses, dietitians, and generalist pharmacists should consider this interactive course as one of the first steps toward becoming a diabetes educator.
ABCs of Diabetes Education is a self-paced, 6-module online course that focuses on the essential knowledge and skills these clinicians will need. Each module in this self-paced course includes:

list-item.p: video vignettes presenting a clinical situation relevant to each module
virtual case study discussions to illustrate the contributions of each member of the multidisciplinary team

sec.p: For more information and to register, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/abc7.
